benchmark_details.name: Knowledge-Injected Curriculum Pretraining Framework for Question Answering
benchmark_details.overview: This paper proposes a general Knowledge-Injected Curriculum Pretraining framework (KICP) designed to achieve comprehensive KG learning and exploitation for question answering tasks. It incorporates knowledge injection, knowledge adaptation, and curriculum reasoning to enable complex reasoning capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance knowledge-based question answering (KBQA) by creating a framework that effectively incorporates knowledge graphs into language models.

data.source: Four real-world datasets including CN-QA, ComplexWebQuestions, FreebaseQA, and Math23K were used for evaluation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance on KBQA tasks across datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in answering questions and reasoning based on knowledge.
methodology.baseline_results: KICP outperformed existing methods significantly on four datasets.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted on multiple datasets demonstrate the efficiency and effectiveness.
